newsitem.title: JORDAN: Jordan Industrial profits rise in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Jordan Industrial profits rise in 1996.

text.p: Jordan Industrial Resources' profits rose 51 percent to 1.4 million dinars ($2 million) in 1996 as income from the sale of a loss-making subsidiary offset lower sales, the company said on Tuesday.

Jordan Industrial Resources, which was set up in 1991 and mainly produces glycerine and fatty acids for detergents, posted a six percent drop in sales to 9.2 million dinars on softer world glycerine prices, it said.
But increased exports to Iraq also cushioned the overall fall. The eight million dinar capitalised firm's owners include Jordan National Bank and Housing Bank.
